content:
The frequency of updating a business continuity plan depends on the specific needs of your business. However, it is generally recommended to review and update the plan at least once a year, or whenever significant changes occur such as a change in your business operations, staff turnovers, new regulations, technology changes, or even external factors such as natural disasters. 

While you may not need to update the plan after every small change, it's important to periodically review and make updates as necessary. If you are uncertain about when to update your business continuity plan, seek advice from professionals who specialize in business continuity planning or consult with your internal teams to identify major changes that may require revisions to the plan.
